Package com.example.librarian_module.sys

Class Book

java.lang.Object
com.example.librarian_module.sys.Item
com.example.librarian_module.sys.Book
public class Book extends Item
The class Book manages the books in the library system. It inherits the class Item. A book can have one more editions (restricted to one for now). Each edition can have one or more copies. Author of the book is saved as an integer representing the author ID (implemented as a separate class Author). Genre is saved as an integer representing the genre ID (implemented as a separate class BookGenre).
Since:
2022-03-04

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book()
      Create an empty Book object.

    • Book

      public Book(String bid, String tle, String lname, String fname, String ed, String ISBN, String yr, String pgs, String cps, String cat)
      Create a Book object with the specified parameters. Creating the object does not mean it has been added to the library system.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      tle - Title of the book.
      lname - Last name of the author of the book.
      fname - First name of the author of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      ISBN - International Standard Book Number of the book.
      yr - Published year of the book.
      pgs - Number of pages of the book.
      cps - Number of copies of the book.
      cat - Genre of the book.

    • Book

      public Book(String bid, String tle, int aid, String ed, String ISBN, String yr, String pgs, String cps, int catid)
      Overloaded constructor to create a Book object with the specified parameters. Creating the object does not mean it has been added to the library system.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      tle - Title of the book.
      aid - Author ID of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      ISBN - International Standard Book Number of the book.
      yr - Published year of the book.
      pgs - Number of pages of the book.
      cps - Number of copies of the book.
      catid - An integer representing the Genre ID of the book.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public static Item.StatusCode add(String bid, String tle, String lname, String fname, String ed, String ISBN, String yr, String pgs, String cps, String cat)
      Add the book with specified parameters to the library system.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      tle - Title of the book.
      lname - Last name of the author of the book.
      fname - First name of the author of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      ISBN - International Standard Book Number of the book.
      yr - Published year of the book.
      pgs - Number of pages of the book.
      cps - Number of copies of the book.
      cat - Genre of the book.
      Returns:
      An enum type StatusCode representing the result of the add book operation.

    • issue

      public static Item.StatusCode issue(String bid, String ed, String bwrid)
      Issue a book with the specified book ID and edition to a borrower with the specified ID.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      bwrid - ID of the borrower of the book.
      Returns:
      An enum type StatusCode representing the result of the issue book operation.

    • returnBack

      public static Item.StatusCode returnBack(String bid, String ed, String bwrid)
      Return a book with the specified book ID and edition from the borrower with the specified ID.
      Parameters:
      bid - ID used as the key of the book.
      ed - An integer representing the edition of the book.
      bwrid - ID of the borrower of the book.
      Returns:
      An enum type StatusCode representing the result of the return book operation.

    • resetRecPtr

      public static void resetRecPtr()
      Reset the record pointer of the books array list.

    • getNextRec

      public static String getNextRec()
      Get data of the book referred to by the record pointer. Data fields are separated by "|".
      Returns:
      A string holding data of the book referred to by the record pointer of the books array list.

    • getEditions

      public ArrayList<BookEdition> getEditions()
      Get the reference of the array list that holds the different editions of the book. Currently, it's assumed that a book has one edition.
      Returns:
      A reference that refers to the array list holding the different editions of the book.
